intro: Anticlea sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin antclea, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short flowering period in late summer and is relatively rare in the wild. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
